Name: Class Instance Self Destruction Control Element
Description: The code contains a class instance that calls the method or function to delete or destroy itself.
ExtendedDescription:
For example, in C++, "delete this" will cause the object to delete itself.


This issue can prevent the product from running reliably. If the relevant code is reachable by an attacker, then this reliability problem might introduce a vulnerability.

MappingNotes.Rationale: This CWE entry is at the Base level of abstraction, which is a preferred level of abstraction for mapping to the root causes of vulnerabilities.
MappingNotes.Comments: Carefully read both the name and description to ensure that this mapping is an appropriate fit. Do not try to 'force' a mapping to a lower-level Base/Variant simply to comply with this preferred level of abstraction.
